result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CRYSTAL A PINTER

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant CRYSTAL A PINTER not in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for CRYSTAL A PINTER on 2020CF127.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2020CF127 and 2022CF112. Court notes the defendant's mail has been returned. Atty Kapelis states he has no information as to the defendant's whereabouts. Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 11:29 AM

10:15 AM Defendant CRYSTAL A PINTER in court.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kapelis appeared by video for CRYSTAL A PINTER. Court notes 20CF127 def has representation from Atty Kapelis but does not yet have an attorney for this case. On 2022CF112 - Def states she would like to have the preliminary hearing later so she can get an attorney. Def waives the time limits.

22CF112 Status of prelim set for Sep 6, 2022 at 11:00 AM.
20CF127 Status Hearing

Court Adjourned at 10:16 AM.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:26 AM Defendant CRYSTAL A PINTER in court.  Atty Michael Kapelis appears with the defendant. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. 2022CF112-Atty Kapelis advises the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant states she will not waive the prelim. Court sets for preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 AM. 2020CF127 to track with this case.

Court adjourned at 9:28 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Electronic Filing Notice has been returned - Return to Sender/Not Deliverable as Addressed/Unable to Forward.

1:23 p.m.  DA Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Crystal Pinter in court with Attorney Michael J Kapelis.

RE: 22CF112 

Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Requests prelim.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond on 22CF112 and 20CF127.  Court sets $500 signature bond on 22CF112.  Court cancels warrant on 20CF127 and reinstates bond.  Court sets status/status of prelim on both cases on July 12, 2022 at 9:00 a.m.  Mandatory appearance.  Atty Kapelis waives time limits for prelim.  
Court adjourned 1:27 p.m.
Status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
